710392f-a.text:
Ninth Ave., east side, north from West 40th Street and showing a portion of a retail market area known popularly as "Paddys Market5 which in the near future will disappear as same; the Lincoln Tunnel
traffic necessitating the removal of obstructions.
December 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

712686f-a.text:
346, 350-352-354 West 40th Street, south side, east of Ninth Avenue. No. 346, here erroneously labeled 350, is a former German Methodist-Episcopal Church which has just been taken over by the Greek Othodox Congregation of Saints Constantine
and Helen.
June, 192V.

712687f-a.text:
3500, 34o, 344 West 40th Street, south side, east of Ninth Avenue No. 34o is the Greek Orthodox Church of Saints Constantine and Helen. which took this edifice over in 1925. (See 346-354 Wesf 40th Stneet, June 1E5). The edifice is shortly to give way t
a six-story garAge.
May 23, 1930.
L. Sperr.

712688f-a.text:
404-418 West 40th Street, south side, west of Ninth Ave. Shown at Nos. 408-412, is the St. Clemen's R.C. Church and School.
August 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

712694f-a.text:
Veat 40th Street (the immediate foreground) north side, between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, shoing a clearance between this point and West 41st Street. This, in conjunction with the buildings on the north side of the latter point will form a portion of the new Dyer Avenue, the aporoach to the new Lincoln Tunnel. The loft building seen in the left background is on the north side of 42nd Street and will r emain, to face the northern extremity of this vehicular roadway.
1arch 18, 1935.
